However, you should keep the Gradle wrapper files, which are already correctly configured in your `.gitignore`:

<augment_code_snippet path=".gitignore" mode="EXCERPT">
```
!gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.jar
!gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The Gradle wrapper (consisting of the wrapper JAR and properties files) should be committed to your repository as they ensure that anyone who clones your project can build it with the exact same Gradle version without needing to install Gradle separately.

Everything else in the `.gradle` directory is generated during builds and should be excluded from version control, which your current `.gitignore` already handles correctly.

It contains IntelliJ IDEA run configurations like your `Run IDE with Plugin.run.xml` file, which are valuable for other developers working on your project.

These run configurations aren't automatically generated and contain specific settings for running your plugin. By committing them to Git, you ensure that everyone on your team has the same run configurations available, making it easier to test and debug the plugin consistently.

Your current `.gitignore` doesn't exclude the `.run` directory, so you're good to go - just commit and push it along with your other project files.

 2	<idea-plugin>
 3	 <id>com.cambra.emtestrunner</id>
 4	 <name>Module Test Runner</name>
 5	 <version>1.0.0</version>
 6	 <vendor email="your.email@example.com" url="https://github.com/yourusername">Your Name</vendor>
 7	 
 8	 <description><![CDATA[
 9	 <p>A configurable test runner plugin for IntelliJ IDEA that allows you to run custom commands for Java and Scala test methods and classes.</p>
 10	
 11	 <h3>Features:</h3>
 12	 <ul>
 13	 <li>Right-click on test methods or classes to run custom commands</li>
 14	 <li>Support for both Java and Scala test frameworks</li>
 15	 <li>Configurable command templates with placeholders</li>
 16	 <li>Package prefix removal for cleaner command names</li>
 17	 <li>Support for JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG, and ScalaTest</li>
 18	 <li>Commands executed in integrated terminal</li>
 19	 <li><strong>Automatic test class tracking:</strong> Automatically tracks the current class being edited for auto-copy features</li>
 20	 </ul>
 21	
 22	 <h3>Supported Languages:</h3>
 23	 <ul>
 24	 <li><strong>Java:</strong> JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG</li>
 25	 <li><strong>Scala:</strong> ScalaTest (FunSuite, FlatSpec, WordSpec, FeatureSpec), JUnit</li>
 26	 </ul>
 27	
 28	 <h3>Usage:</h3>
 29	 <ol>
 30	 <li>Configure commands in Settings Tools Module Test Runner</li>
 31	 <li>Use {METHOD_NAME} and {CLASS_NAME} placeholders in your commands</li>
 32	 <li>Right-click on test methods or classes to execute</li>
 33	 </ol>
 34	
 35	 <p>Perfect for Maven, Gradle, SBT, or custom test execution workflows.</p>
 36	 ]]></description>
 37	 
 38	 <change-notes><![CDATA[
 39	 <h3>Version 1.0.0</h3>
 40	 <ul>
 41	 <li>Initial release</li>
 42	 <li>Configurable command templates</li>
 43	 <li>Package prefix removal feature</li>
 44	 <li>Support for test methods and classes</li>
 45	 </ul>
 46	 ]]></change-notes>

Path: src/main/kotlin/com/cambra/emtestrunner/PluginStartupActivity.kt
 1	package com.cambra.emtestrunner
 2	
 3	import com.intellij.notification.NotificationGroupManager
 4	import com.intellij.notification.NotificationType
 5	import com.intellij.openapi.project.Project
 6	import com.intellij.openapi.startup.StartupActivity
 7	
 8	/**
 9	 * Startup activity that runs when a project is opened
 10	 */
 11	class PluginStartupActivity : StartupActivity {
 12	 override fun runActivity(project: Project) {
 13	 // This should definitely be called when a project opens
 14	 println("PluginStartupActivity: runActivity called for project ${project.name}")
 15	 
 16	 try {
 17	 // Show notification that startup activity is running
 18	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 19	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 20	 .createNotification(
 21	 "Startup Activity",
 22	 "PluginStartupActivity running for project: ${project.name}",
 23	 NotificationType.INFORMATION
 24	 )
 25	 .notify(project)
 26	 
 27	 // Initialize the TestClassTracker service
 28	 val tracker = project.getService(TestClassTracker::class.java)
 29	 
 30	 // Show confirmation
 31	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 32	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 33	 .createNotification(
 34	 "Service Auto-Init",
 35	 "TestClassTracker auto-initialized via StartupActivity: ${tracker != null}",
 36	 NotificationType.INFORMATION
 37	 )
 38	 .notify(project)
 39	 
 40	 println("PluginStartupActivity: Successfully initialized TestClassTracker for ${project.name}")
 41	 
 42	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 43	 println("PluginStartupActivity: Error initializing for ${project.name}: ${e.message}")
 44	 
 45	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 46	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 47	 .createNotification(
 48	 "Startup Error",
 49	 "Error in PluginStartupActivity: ${e.message}",
 50	 NotificationType.ERROR
 51	 )
 52	 .notify(project)
 53	 }
 54	 }
 55	}

Path: src/main/kotlin/com/cambra/emtestrunner/settings/ModuleTestRunnerSettings.kt
 1	package com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings
 2	
 3	import com.intellij.openapi.application.ApplicationManager
 4	import com.intellij.openapi.components.PersistentStateComponent
 5	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Service
 6	import com.intellij.openapi.components.State
 7	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Storage
 8	import com.intellij.util.xmlb.XmlSerializerUtil
 9	
 10	@Service
 11	@State(
 12	 name = "ModuleTestRunnerSettings",
 13	 storages = [Storage("ModuleTestRunnerSettings.xml")]
 14	)
 15	class ModuleTestRunnerSettings : PersistentStateComponent<ModuleTestRunnerSettings> {
 16	 
 17	 var buildRunMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running test for: {METHOD_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {METHOD_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 18	 var buildRunClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running tests for class: {CLASS_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {CLASS_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 19	 var runMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running method: {METHOD_NAME}\""
 20	 var runClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running class: {CLASS_NAME}\""
 21	 var copyCommand: String = "echo \"Copying {COMPILED_CLASS_PATH} to execution host\""
 22	 var removePackagePrefix: String = ""
 23	 var namespace: String = ""
 24	 var enableAutoCopy: Boolean = true
 25	
 26	 override fun getState(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings = this
 27	 
 28	 override fun loadState(state: ModuleTestRunnerSettings) {
 29	 XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(state, this)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 companion object {
 33	 fun getInstance(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings {
 34	 return ApplicationManager.getApplication().getService(ModuleTestRunnerSettings::class.java)
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Replace placeholders in the command template with actual values
 40	 */
 41	 fun buildMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 42	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 43	 return buildRunMethodCommand
 44	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 45	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 46	 }
 47	
 48	 fun buildClassCommand(className: String): String {
 49	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 50	 return buildRunClassCommand
 51	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 52	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 53	 }
 54	
 55	 fun buildFastRunMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 56	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 57	 return runMethodCommand
 58	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 59	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 fun buildFastRunClassCommand(className: String): String {
 63	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 64	 return runClassCommand
 65	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 66	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 67	 }
 68	
 69	 /**
 70	 * Remove the configured package prefix from the given name
 71	 */
 72	 private fun removePrefix(name: String): String {
 73	 return if (removePackagePrefix.isNotEmpty() && name.startsWith(removePackagePrefix)) {
 74	 name.removePrefix(removePackagePrefix).removePrefix(".")
 75	 } else {
 76	 name
 77	 }
 78	 }
 79	}

Path: src/main/kotlin/com/cambra/emtestrunner/settings/ModuleTestRunnerConfigurable.kt
 1	package com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings
 2	
 3	import com.intellij.openapi.options.Configurable
 4	import com.intellij.openapi.ui.DialogPanel
 5	import com.intellij.ui.dsl.builder.*
 6	import javax.swing.JComponent
 7	
 8	class TestRunnerConfigurable : Configurable {
 9	 
 10	 private var settingsComponent: TestRunnerSettingsComponent? = null
 11	 
 12	 override fun getDisplayName(): String = "Module Test Runner"
 13	 
 14	 override fun getPreferredFocusedComponent(): JComponent? {
 15	 return settingsComponent?.getPreferredFocusedComponent()
 16	 }
 17	 
 18	 override fun createComponent(): JComponent? {
 19	 settingsComponent = TestRunnerSettingsComponent()
 20	 return settingsComponent?.panel
 21	 }
 22	 
 23	 override fun isModified(): Boolean {
 24	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 25	 return settingsComponent?.methodCommandText != settings.buildRunMethodCommand ||
 26	 settingsComponent?.classCommandText != settings.buildRunClassCommand ||
 27	 settingsComponent?.runMethodCommandText != settings.runMethodCommand ||
 28	 settingsComponent?.runClassCommandText != settings.runClassCommand ||
 29	 settingsComponent?.copyCommandText != settings.copyCommand ||
 30	 settingsComponent?.removePackagePrefixText != settings.removePackagePrefix ||
 31	 settingsComponent?.namespaceText != settings.namespace ||
 32	 settingsComponent?.enableAutoCopyChecked != settings.enableAutoCopy
 33	 }
 34	 
 35	 override fun apply() {
 36	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 37	 settingsComponent?.let {
 38	 settings.buildRunMethodCommand = it.methodCommandText
 39	 settings.buildRunClassCommand = it.classCommandText
 40	 settings.runMethodCommand = it.runMethodCommandText
 41	 settings.runClassCommand = it.runClassCommandText
 42	 settings.copyCommand = it.copyCommandText
 43	 settings.removePackagePrefix = it.removePackagePrefixText
 44	 settings.namespace = it.namespaceText
 45	 }
 46	 }
 47	 
 48	 override fun reset() {
 49	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 50	 settingsComponent?.let {
 51	 it.methodCommandText = settings.buildRunMethodCommand
 52	 it.classCommandText = settings.buildRunClassCommand
 53	 it.runMethodCommandText = settings.runMethodCommand
 54	 it.runClassCommandText = settings.runClassCommand
 55	 it.copyCommandText = settings.copyCommand
 56	 it.removePackagePrefixText = settings.removePackagePrefix
 57	 it.namespaceText = settings.namespace
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 
 61	 override fun disposeUIResources() {
 62	 settingsComponent = null
 63	 }
 64	}

 33	
 34	 protected open fun getDisplayFormat(): String = RUN_MODULE_TEST_FORMAT
 35	 protected open fun getTerminalTabName(): String = "Module Test Runner"
 36	 override fun actionPerformed(e: AnActionEvent) {
 37	 val project = e.project ?: return
 38	 val element = e.getData(LangDataKeys.PSI_ELEMENT)
 39	 val psiFile = e.getData(LangDataKeys.PSI_FILE)
 40	
 41	 // Handle different PSI elements
 42	 when {
 43	 element is PsiMethod -> {
 44	 if (!isJavaTestMethod(element)) return
 45	 handleMethod(project, element)
 46	 }
 47	
 48	 element != null && isScalaFunction(element) -> {
 49	 if (!isScalaTestMethod(element)) return
 50	 handleScalaFunction(project, element)
 51	 }
 52	
 53	 element is PsiClass -> {
 54	 handleClass(project, element)
 55	 }

 227	 var className = "Unknown"

 246

 248	 val copyCmd = settings.copyCommand
 249	 .replace("{COMPILED_CLASS_PATH}", compiledFilePath)
 250	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", settings.namespace)
 251	
 252	 // Run the command in background
 253	 runCommandInBackground(project, copyCmd, compiledFilePath, className)
 254	 } catch (e: Exception) {

 320	 private fun buildCompiledClassPath(psiInfo: PsiInfo): String {
 321	 // For Maven, we only want to check the target/test-classes directory
 322	 val mavenTestOutputDir = findBuildOutputDir(psiInfo.projectBasePath, "target/test-classes")
 323	 ?: return "Maven test-classes directory not found. Make sure this is a Maven project with compiled tests."
 324	
 325	 val packagePath = psiInfo.packageName.replace('.', java.io.File.separatorChar)
 326	
 327	 // For Scala classes, check both normal and $ versions
 328	 if (psiInfo.isScala) {
 329	 val classPath = "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}.class"
 330	 val objectPath = "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}$$.class"
 331	
 332	 // Return the path that exists, or the class path as default
 333	 return if (java.io.File(objectPath).exists()) objectPath else classPath
 334	 }
 335	
 336	 // For Java classes, just return the normal path
 337	 return "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}.class"
 338	 }

IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "README.md", "file_content": "# Module Test Runner Plugin\n\nA configurable IntelliJ IDEA plugin that allows you to run custom commands for Java and Scala test methods and classes. Perfect for Maven, Gradle, SBT, or custom test execution workflows.\n\n## Features\n\n### Core Functionality\n- **Right-click test execution**: Run custom commands on test methods and classes via context menu\n- **Dual language support**: Works with both Java and Scala test frameworks\n- **Configurable commands**: Fully customizable command templates with placeholder support\n- **Package prefix removal**: Clean up command names by removing specified package prefixes\n- **Terminal integration**: Commands executed in IntelliJ's integrated terminal\n- **Automatic test class tracking**: Tracks the current class being edited for auto-copy features\n\n### Supported Test Frameworks\n- **Java**: JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG\n- **Scala**: ScalaTest (FunSuite, FlatSpec, WordSpec, FeatureSpec), JUnit\n\n### Command Types\n- **Build & Run Commands**: Full build and test execution (slower but comprehensive)\n- **Fast Run Commands**: Quick execution without full build (faster for iterative testing)\n- **Auto-Copy**: Automatically copy compiled test classes after successful compilation\n\n## Installation\n\n### From Source\n1. Clone this repository\n2. Build the plugin using Gradle:\n ```bash\n ./gradlew buildPlugin\n ```\n3. Install the generated plugin file from `build/distributions/` in IntelliJ IDEA\n\n### Development Setup\n1. Clone the repository\n2. Open in IntelliJ IDEA\n3. Run the plugin in a development instance:\n ```bash\n ./gradlew runIde\n ```\n\n## Configuration\n\n### Settings Location\nGo to **Settings \u2192 Tools \u2192 Module Test Runner** to configure the plugin.\n\n### Available Settings\n\n#### Command Templates\n- **Build Run Method Command**: Command executed for individual test methods (with build)\n- **Build Run Class Command**: Command executed for test classes (with build)\n- **Run Method Command**: Fast command for individual test methods (without build)\n- **Run Class Command**: Fast command for test classes (without build)\n- **Copy Command**: Command to copy compiled classes to execution host\n\n#### Configuration Options\n- **Remove Package Prefix**: Remove specified content from class/method names\n- **Namespace**: Custom namespace value for command placeholders\n- **Enable Auto Copy**: Automatically copy compiled classes after successful compilation\n\n#### Placeholder Variables\nUse these placeholders in your command templates:\n- `{METHOD_NAME}`: Full method name (format: `package.className#methodName`)\n- `{CLASS_NAME}`: Full class name (format: `package.className`)\n- `{NAMESPACE}`: Custom namespace value from settings\n- `{COMPILED_CLASS_PATH}`: Path to compiled class file (for copy command)\n\n### Example Configurations\n\n#### Maven Project\n```bash\n# Build Run Method Command\nmvn test -Dtest={METHOD_NAME} -Dnamespace={NAMESPACE}\n\n# Build Run Class Command \nmvn test -Dtest={CLASS_NAME} -Dnamespace={NAMESPACE}\n\n# Copy Command\nscp {COMPILED_CLASS_PATH} user@host:/remote/path/\n```\n\n#### Gradle Project\n```bash\n# Build Run Method Command\n./gradlew test --tests {METHOD_NAME}\n\n# Build Run Class Command\n./gradlew test --tests {CLASS_NAME}\n```\n\n#### SBT Project (Scala)\n```bash\n# Build Run Method Command\nsbt \"testOnly {CLASS_NAME} -- -z {METHOD_NAME}\"\n\n# Build Run Class Command\nsbt \"testOnly {CLASS_NAME}\"\n```\n\n## Usage\n\n### Running Tests\n\n#### Context Menu Options\n1. **Right-click on a test method**: Shows \"Run module test 'methodName'\"\n2. **Right-click on a test class**: Shows \"Run module test 'className'\" \n3. **Right-click on a file with tests**: Shows \"Run fileName module tests\"\n\n#### Available Actions\n- **Run module test**: Execute build & run command (Ctrl+Shift+F10)\n- **Run module test (fast)**: Execute fast run command (Ctrl+Alt+Shift+F10)\n\n#### Auto-Copy Feature\nWhen enabled, the plugin automatically:\n1. Tracks the currently edited test class\n2. Monitors compilation status\n3. Copies compiled class files after successful compilation\n4. Shows notifications for success/failure\n\n### Keyboard Shortcuts\n- **Ctrl+Shift+F10**: Run module test (build & run)\n- **Ctrl+Alt+Shift+F10**: Run module test (fast)\n\n## Building and Testing\n\n### Build the Plugin\n```bash\n./gradlew buildPlugin\n```\n\n### Run in Development Mode\n```bash\n./gradlew runIde\n```\n\n### Run Tests\n```bash\n./gradlew test\n```\n\n### Verify Plugin Compatibility\n```bash\n./gradlew verifyPlugin\n```\n\n### Build Distribution\n```bash\n./gradlew buildPlugin\n```\nThe plugin ZIP file will be created in `build/distributions/`.\n\n## Development\n\n### Project Structure\n```\nsrc/main/kotlin/com/cambra/emtestrunner/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 RunModuleTestAction.kt # Main action for running tests\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 FastRunModuleTestAction.kt # Fast run action\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 AutoCopyCompiledTestService.kt # Auto-copy and tracking service\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 PluginStartupActivity.kt # Plugin initialization\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 settings/\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 ModuleTestRunnerSettings.kt # Settings persistence\n\u2502 \u251c\u2500\u2500 ModuleTestRunnerConfigurable.kt # Settings UI\n\u2502 \u2514\u2500\u2500 TestRunnerSettingsComponent.kt # Settings form\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 icons/\n \u2514\u2500\u2500 PluginIcons.kt # Plugin icons\n```\n\n### Key Components\n- **TestClassTracker**: Service that tracks current test class and handles auto-copy\n- **ModuleTestRunnerSettings**: Persistent settings storage\n- **RunModuleTestAction**: Main action for executing test commands\n- **PluginStartupActivity**: Initializes services when project opens\n\n### Requirements\n- **IntelliJ IDEA**: 2023.1+ (build 231+)\n- **Java**: JDK 21+\n- **Kotlin**: 2.1.0+\n- **Dependencies**: Java plugin, Terminal plugin, Scala plugin (optional)\n\n## Troubleshooting\n\n### Common Issues\n\n#### Auto-Copy Not Working\n- Ensure \"Enable Auto Copy\" is checked in settings\n- Verify the TestClassTracker service is initialized (check notifications)\n- Make sure you're editing a test class file\n\n#### Commands Not Executing\n- Check terminal output for error messages\n- Verify command templates are correctly configured\n- Ensure placeholders are properly formatted\n\n#### Menu Items Not Appearing\n- Verify you're right-clicking on test methods/classes\n- Check that the file contains recognized test annotations\n- Ensure the plugin is enabled in Settings \u2192 Plugins\n\n### Debug Information\nThe plugin shows notifications for:\n- Service initialization status\n- Auto-copy success/failure\n- Command execution results\n\n## Contributing\n\n1.  8	 <description><![CDATA[
 9	 <p>A configurable test runner plugin for IntelliJ IDEA that allows you to run custom commands for Java and Scala test methods and classes.</p>
 10	
 11	 <h3>Features:</h3>
 12	 <ul>
 13	 <li>Right-click on test methods or classes to run custom commands</li>
 14	 <li>Support for both Java and Scala test frameworks</li>
 15	 <li>Configurable command templates with placeholders</li>
 16	 <li>Package prefix removal for cleaner command names</li>
 17	 <li>Support for JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG, and ScalaTest</li>
 18	 <li>Commands executed in integrated terminal</li>
 19	 <li><strong>Automatic test class tracking:</strong> Automatically tracks the current class being edited for auto-copy features</li>
 20	 </ul>
 21	
 22	 <h3>Supported Languages:</h3>
 23	 <ul>
 24	 <li><strong>Java:</strong> JUnit 4, JUnit 5, TestNG</li>
 25	 <li><strong>Scala:</strong> ScalaTest (FunSuite, FlatSpec, WordSpec, FeatureSpec), JUnit</li>
 26	 </ul>
 27	
 28	 <h3>Usage:</h3>
 29	 <ol>
 30	 <li>Configure commands in Settings Tools Module Test Runner</li>
 31	 <li>Use {METHOD_NAME} and {CLASS_NAME} placeholders in your commands</li>
 32	 <li>Right-click on test methods or classes to execute</li>
 33	 </ol>
 34	
 35	 <p>Perfect for Maven, Gradle, SBT, or custom test execution workflows.</p>

 3	import com.intellij.notification.NotificationGroupManager
 4	import com.intellij.notification.NotificationType
 5	import com.intellij.openapi.project.Project
 6	import com.intellij.openapi.startup.StartupActivity
 7	
 8	/**
 9	 * Startup activity that runs when a project is opened
 10	 */
 11	class PluginStartupActivity : StartupActivity {
 12	 override fun runActivity(project: Project) {
 13	 // This should definitely be called when a project opens
 14	 println("PluginStartupActivity: runActivity called for project ${project.name}")
 15	 
 16	 try {
 17	 // Show notification that startup activity is running
 18	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 19	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 20	 .createNotification(
 21	 "Startup Activity",
 22	 "PluginStartupActivity running for project: ${project.name}",
 23	 NotificationType.INFORMATION
 24	 )
 25	 .notify(project)
 26	 
 27	 // Initialize the TestClassTracker service
 28	 val tracker = project.getService(TestClassTracker::class.java)
 29	 
 30	 // Show confirmation
 31	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 32	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 33	 .createNotification(
 34	 "Service Auto-Init",
 35	 "TestClassTracker auto-initialized via StartupActivity: ${tracker != null}",
 36	 NotificationType.INFORMATION
 37	 )
 38	 .notify(project)
 39	 
 40	 println("PluginStartupActivity: Successfully initialized TestClassTracker for ${project.name}")
 41	 
 42	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 43	 println("PluginStartupActivity: Error initializing for ${project.name}: ${e.message}")
 44	 
 45	 NotificationGroupManager.getInstance()
 46	 .getNotificationGroup("PluginDebug")
 47	 .createNotification(
 48	 "Startup Error",
 49	 "Error in PluginStartupActivity: ${e.message}",
 50	 NotificationType.ERROR
 51	 )
 52	 .notify(project)
 53	 }
 54	 }
 55	}

 1	package com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings
 2	
 3	import com.intellij.openapi.application.ApplicationManager
 4	import com.intellij.openapi.components.PersistentStateComponent
 5	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Service
 6	import com.intellij.openapi.components.State
 7	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Storage
 8	import com.intellij.util.xmlb.XmlSerializerUtil
 9	
 10	@Service
 11	@State(
 12	 name = "ModuleTestRunnerSettings",
 13	 storages = [Storage("ModuleTestRunnerSettings.xml")]
 14	)
 15	class ModuleTestRunnerSettings : PersistentStateComponent<ModuleTestRunnerSettings> {
 16	 
 17	 var buildRunMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running test for: {METHOD_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {METHOD_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 18	 var buildRunClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running tests for class: {CLASS_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {CLASS_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 19	 var runMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running method: {METHOD_NAME}\""
 20	 var runClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running class: {CLASS_NAME}\""
 21	 var copyCommand: String = "echo \"Copying {COMPILED_CLASS_PATH} to execution host\""
 22	 var removePackagePrefix: String = ""
 23	 var namespace: String = ""
 24	 var enableAutoCopy: Boolean = true
 25	
 26	 override fun getState(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings = this
 27	 
 28	 override fun loadState(state: ModuleTestRunnerSettings) {
 29	 XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(state, this)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 companion object {
 33	 fun getInstance(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings {
 34	 return ApplicationManager.getApplication().getService(ModuleTestRunnerSettings::class.java)
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Replace placeholders in the command template with actual values
 40	 */
 41	 fun buildMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 42	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 43	 return buildRunMethodCommand
 44	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 45	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 46	 }
 47	
 48	 fun buildClassCommand(className: String): String {
 49	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 50	 return buildRunClassCommand
 51	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 52	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 53	 }
 54	
 55	 fun buildFastRunMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 56	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 57	 return runMethodCommand
 58	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 59	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 fun buildFastRunClassCommand(className: String): String {
 63	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 64	 return runClassCommand
 65	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 66	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 67	 }
 68	
 69	 /**
 70	 * Remove the configured package prefix from the given name
 71	 */
 72	 private fun removePrefix(name: String): String {
 73	 return if (removePackagePrefix.isNotEmpty() && name.startsWith(removePackagePrefix)) {
 74	 name.removePrefix(removePackagePrefix).removePrefix(".")
 75	 } else {
 76	 name
 77	 }
 78	 }
 79	}

 8	class TestRunnerConfigurable : Configurable {
 9	 
 10	 private var settingsComponent: TestRunnerSettingsComponent? = null
 11	 
 12	 override fun getDisplayName(): String = "Module Test Runner"
 13	 
 14	 override fun getPreferredFocusedComponent(): JComponent? {
 15	 return settingsComponent?.getPreferredFocusedComponent()
 16	 }
 17	 
 18	 override fun createComponent(): JComponent? {
 19	 settingsComponent = TestRunnerSettingsComponent()
 20	 return settingsComponent?.panel
 21	 }
 22	 
 23	 override fun isModified(): Boolean {
 24	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 25	 return settingsComponent?.methodCommandText != settings.buildRunMethodCommand ||
 26	 settingsComponent?.classCommandText != settings.buildRunClassCommand ||
 27	 settingsComponent?.runMethodCommandText != settings.runMethodCommand ||
 28	 settingsComponent?.runClassCommandText != settings.runClassCommand ||
 29	 settingsComponent?.copyCommandText != settings.copyCommand ||
 30	 settingsComponent?.removePackagePrefixText != settings.removePackagePrefix ||
 31	 settingsComponent?.namespaceText != settings.namespace ||
 32	 settingsComponent?.enableAutoCopyChecked != settings.enableAutoCopy
 33	 }
 34	 
 35	 override fun apply() {
 36	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 37	 settingsComponent?.let {
 38	 settings.buildRunMethodCommand = it.methodCommandText
 39	 settings.buildRunClassCommand = it.classCommandText
 40	 settings.runMethodCommand = it.runMethodCommandText
 41	 settings.runClassCommand = it.runClassCommandText
 42	 settings.copyCommand = it.copyCommandText
 43	 settings.removePackagePrefix = it.removePackagePrefixText
 44	 settings.namespace = it.namespaceText
 45	 }
 46	 }
 47	 
 48	 override fun reset() {
 49	 val settings = ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 50	 settingsComponent?.let {
 51	 it.methodCommandText = settings.buildRunMethodCommand
 52	 it.classCommandText = settings.buildRunClassCommand
 53	 it.runMethodCommandText = settings.runMethodCommand
 54	 it.runClassCommandText = settings.runClassCommand
 55	 it.copyCommandText = settings.copyCommand
 56	 it.removePackagePrefixText = settings.removePackagePrefix
 57	 it.namespaceText = settings.namespace
 58	 }
 59	 }
 60	 
 61	 override fun disposeUIResources() {
 62	 settingsComponent = null
 63	 }

 29	@Service(Service.Level.PROJECT)
 30	class TestClassTracker(private val project: Project) : Disposable {
 31	 // Change from public var to private var to avoid generating public setter
 32	 private var currentTestClass: PsiClass? = null
 33	 var currentTestFile: PsiFile? = null
 34	 var currentScalaElement: PsiElement? = null
 35	 var isScalaClass: Boolean = false
 36	 private var messageBusConnection: MessageBusConnection? = null
 37	
 38	 init {
 39	 // Register compilation listener using MessageBus (modern approach)
 40	 messageBusConnection = project.messageBus.connect()
 41	 messageBusConnection?.subscribe(CompilerTopics.COMPILATION_STATUS, object : CompilationStatusListener {
 42	 override fun compilationFinished(aborted: Boolean, errors: Int, warnings: Int, context: CompileContext) {
 43	 val settings = com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings.ModuleTestRunnerSettings.getInstance()
 44	 if (settings.enableAutoCopy && !aborted && errors == 0 && (currentTestClass != null || currentScalaElement != null)) {
 45	 // Compilation successful, copy the compiled class
 46	 copyCompiledClass()
 47	 }
 48	 }
 49	 })
 50	
 51	 // Register file editor listener to automatically track current class being edited
 52	 messageBusConnection?.subscribe(FileEditorManagerListener.FILE_EDITOR_MANAGER, object : FileEditorManagerListener {
 53	 override fun selectionChanged(event: FileEditorManagerEvent) {
 54	 // Always try to update, let the method check settings internally
 55	 updateCurrentTestClassFromEditor()
 56	 }
 57	
 58	 override fun fileOpened(source: FileEditorManager, file: VirtualFile) {
 59	 // Also update when a file is opened
 60	 updateCurrentTestClassFromEditor()
 61	 }
 62	 })
 63	
 64	 // Set initial test class from currently active editor
 65	 updateCurrentTestClassFromEditor()
 66	 }
 67	
 68	 override fun dispose() {
 69	 messageBusConnection?.disconnect()
 70	 messageBusConnection = null
 71	 }

 224	 fun copyCompiledClass() {
 225	 // Move everything to background thread to avoid EDT violations
 226	 ApplicationManager.getApplication().executeOnPooledThread {
 227	 var className = "Unknown"
 228	 try {
 229	 // First, collect PSI information in read action (no file system operations)
 230	 val psiInfo = ReadAction.compute<PsiInfo, Exception> {
 231	 if (isScalaClass) {
 232	 getScalaPsiInfo(currentScalaElement!!)
 233	 } else {
 234	 getJavaPsiInfo(currentTestClass!!)
 235	 }
 236	 }
 237	
 238	 className = psiInfo.className
 239	
 240	 // Now perform file system operations outside of PSI access
 241	 val compiledFilePath = buildCompiledClassPath(psiInfo)
 242	
 243	 // Get the settings
 244	 val settings = com.intellij.openapi.application.ApplicationManager.getApplication()
 245	 .getService(com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings.ModuleTestRunnerSettings::class.java)
 246	
 247	 // Replace placeholders in the copy command
 248	 val copyCmd = settings.copyCommand
 249	 .replace("{COMPILED_CLASS_PATH}", compiledFilePath)
 250	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", settings.namespace)
 251	
 252	 // Run the command in background
 253	 runCommandInBackground(project, copyCmd, compiledFilePath, className)
 254	 } catch (e: Exception) {
 255	 // Show error on EDT
 256	 ApplicationManager.getApplication().invokeLater {
 257	 Messages.showErrorDialog(
 258	 project,
 259	 "Error copying compiled class '$className': ${e.message}",
 260	 "Copy Error"
 261	 )
 262	
 263	 // Show error notification
 264	 showNotification(
 265	 project,
 266	 "Copy Failed",
 267	 "Failed to copy compiled class '$className': ${e.message}",
 268	 NotificationType.ERROR
 269	 )
 270	 }
 271	 }
 272	 }
 273	 }

 319	 // Build compiled class path using PSI info and file system operations
 320	 private fun buildCompiledClassPath(psiInfo: PsiInfo): String {
 321	 // For Maven, we only want to check the target/test-classes directory
 322	 val mavenTestOutputDir = findBuildOutputDir(psiInfo.projectBasePath, "target/test-classes")
 323	 ?: return "Maven test-classes directory not found. Make sure this is a Maven project with compiled tests."
 324	
 325	 val packagePath = psiInfo.packageName.replace('.', java.io.File.separatorChar)
 326	
 327	 // For Scala classes, check both normal and $ versions
 328	 if (psiInfo.isScala) {
 329	 val classPath = "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}.class"
 330	 val objectPath = "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}$$.class"
 331	
 332	 // Return the path that exists, or the class path as default
 333	 return if (java.io.File(objectPath).exists()) objectPath else classPath
 334	 }
 335	
 336	 // For Java classes, just return the normal path
 337	 return "$mavenTestOutputDir${java.io.File.separator}$packagePath${java.io.File.separator}${psiInfo.className}.class"
 338	 }
 339	
 340	 private fun getCompiledPathForClass(psiClass: PsiClass): String {
 341	 val project = psiClass.project
 342	 val containingFile = psiClass.containingFile
 343	
 344	 // Handle both Java and Scala files
 345	 val virtualFile = containingFile.virtualFile ?: return "No virtual file"
 346	 val module = ModuleUtil.findModuleForFile(virtualFile, project) ?: return "No module found"
 347	
 348	 // For Maven, we only want to check the target/test-classes directory
 349	 val mavenTestOutputDir = findBuildOutputDir(project.basePath, "target/test-classes")
 350	
 351	 // If Maven test directory doesn't exist, return a message
 352	 if (mavenTestOutputDir == null) {
 353	 return "Maven test-classes directory not found. Make sure this is a Maven project with compiled tests."
 354	 }

 1	package com.cambra.emtestrunner.settings
 2	
 3	import com.intellij.openapi.application.ApplicationManager
 4	import com.intellij.openapi.components.PersistentStateComponent
 5	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Service
 6	import com.intellij.openapi.components.State
 7	import com.intellij.openapi.components.Storage
 8	import com.intellij.util.xmlb.XmlSerializerUtil
 9	
 10	@Service
 11	@State(
 12	 name = "ModuleTestRunnerSettings",
 13	 storages = [Storage("ModuleTestRunnerSettings.xml")]
 14	)
 15	class ModuleTestRunnerSettings : PersistentStateComponent<ModuleTestRunnerSettings> {
 16	 
 17	 var buildRunMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running test for: {METHOD_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {METHOD_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 18	 var buildRunClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running tests for class: {CLASS_NAME}\"; echo \"This will take 5-10 minutes...\"; echo {CLASS_NAME} -p namespace={NAMESPACE}"
 19	 var runMethodCommand: String = "echo \"Running method: {METHOD_NAME}\""
 20	 var runClassCommand: String = "echo \"Running class: {CLASS_NAME}\""
 21	 var copyCommand: String = "echo \"Copying {COMPILED_CLASS_PATH} to execution host\""
 22	 var removePackagePrefix: String = ""
 23	 var namespace: String = ""
 24	 var enableAutoCopy: Boolean = true
 25	
 26	 override fun getState(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings = this
 27	 
 28	 override fun loadState(state: ModuleTestRunnerSettings) {
 29	 XmlSerializerUtil.copyBean(state, this)
 30	 }
 31	 
 32	 companion object {
 33	 fun getInstance(): ModuleTestRunnerSettings {
 34	 return ApplicationManager.getApplication().getService(ModuleTestRunnerSettings::class.java)
 35	 }
 36	 }
 37	 
 38	 /**
 39	 * Replace placeholders in the command template with actual values
 40	 */
 41	 fun buildMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 42	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 43	 return buildRunMethodCommand
 44	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 45	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 46	 }
 47	
 48	 fun buildClassCommand(className: String): String {
 49	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 50	 return buildRunClassCommand
 51	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 52	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 53	 }
 54	
 55	 fun buildFastRunMethodCommand(fullMethodName: String): String {
 56	 val processedMethodName = removePrefix(fullMethodName)
 57	 return runMethodCommand
 58	 .replace("{METHOD_NAME}", processedMethodName)
 59	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 60	 }
 61	
 62	 fun buildFastRunClassCommand(className: String): String {
 63	 val processedClassName = removePrefix(className)
 64	 return runClassCommand
 65	 .replace("{CLASS_NAME}", processedClassName)
 66	 .replace("{NAMESPACE}", namespace)
 67	 }
 68	
 69	 /**
 70	 * Remove the configured package prefix from the given name
 71	 */
 72	 private fun removePrefix(name: String): String {
 73	 return if (removePackagePrefix.isNotEmpty() && name.startsWith(removePackagePrefix)) {
 74	 name.removePrefix(removePackagePrefix).removePrefix(".")
 75	 } else {
 76	 name
 77	 }
 78	 }
 79	}
